title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Burns, who was friendly to the latter party, here allegorises the contest ; characterising Dumfries as Maggy on the banks of Nith ; Annan, as Bess of Annandale ; Kirkcudbright, as Whisky Jean of Galloway; Sanquhar, as Black Joan frae Chrichton Peel; and Lochraaben «s Marjory of the many lochs — appellations, «11 of which have some appropriateness from local circumstances.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: — At the general election, 1790, the representation of the five boroughs of Dumfries, Annan, Kirkcudbright,  Sanquhar, and Lochraaben, forming one electoral district, was contested by Sir James Johnstone, of Westerhall, in the ministerial or Tory, and Captain Patrick IMiller, the younger, of Dalswinton, in the Whig or opposition interest.

snippet: From Annan, Burns proceeded to Dumfries, and thence through Sanquhar, to Mossgiel, near Mauchline, in Ayrshire, ■ where he arrived about the 8th of June, 1787, after a long absence of six busy and eventful months.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
